item.title: CCPD & NY Independent System Operator Info Session | Oct. 21
item.description: On Tuesday, October 21st, join the CCPD and NY Independent System Operator to discover how NYISO helps keep New York’s power grid reliable and efficient, as well as how you can gain hands-on experience in areas like engineering, IT, economics, and more. Meet the NYISO team, ask questions, and learn about their co-op opportunities. Registration and additional details are available in Handshake.

item.title: Fall 2025 School of Engineering Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Friday, October 10, 2025 (all day) - Fall 2025 School of Engineering (SoE) Midterm course evaluations are now open. Your feedback is very important to the Institute and the school, so please complete the SoE midterm evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Thursday, October 23, 2025.

item.title: Reduce and Reuse: Introducing the Chemical ReUse Program
item.description: RPI is committed to reducing chemical waste and promoting responsible resource management across campus. To advance these goals, Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) is launching a Chemical ReUse Program, a new initiative that helps laboratories share surplus chemicals and reduce disposal needs.

item.title: Get Your Message on Campus Screens - Learn How! | Oct. 16
item.description: Join Jim Evans, Director of Multi Media Services, on Thursday October 16th from 11am-12pm for a hands-on webinar about Carousel Digital Signage, RPI’s campus-wide signage system. Whether you’re promoting an event, sharing a campus update, or spotlighting a team achievement, this training will help you get your message on screens across RPI. Open to RPI campus community only. Register online at https://rensselaer.webex.com/weblink/register/rf01c7b66cceead46ccb48bd624c388dc

item.title: Dr. Azita Hirsa Receives the Rensselaer Alumni Association (RAA) Teaching Award
item.description: The Industrial and Systems Engineering Department proudly celebrates Dr. Azita Hirsa, recipient of the RAA Teaching Award. Dr. Hirsa’s courses in professional development, ethics, and management of engineering and technology inspire students to connect technical excellence with integrity, purpose, and collaboration. “Students learn best when they feel supported, challenged, and seen as collaborators in our learning journey,” said Dr. Hirsa. “This recognition affirms that those efforts matter.”

item.title: Faculty and Staff In-Person Workshop: Get Wise with the Owl | Oct. 22
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 22, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Discover how to make the most of your Meeting Owl! Whether your department already has an Owl or you’re considering one, this hands-on workshop will walk you through everything you need to know — from setup and placement to an overview of benefits and key features like 360° video, automatic speaker tracking, and pairing devices.
